WSJ1829:0	[Silicon Valley] :[/LOCATION] heaved a sigh of relief yesterday .

WSJ1829:1	Though details were sketchy in the aftermath of the violent earthquake that shook the high-tech corridor along with the rest of the [San Francisco Bay] :[/FACILITY] area , a spot check of computer makers turned up little , if any , potentially lingering damage to facilities or fabrication equipment .

WSJ1829:2	Analysts and corporate officials said they expected practically no long-term disruption in shipments from the [Valley] :[/LOCATION] of either hardware or software goods .

WSJ1829:3	[Intel Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , [Advanced Micro Devices Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [National Semiconductor Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] were all up and running yesterday , though many workers were forced to stay home because of damaged roadways ; others elected to take the day off .

WSJ1829:4	`` These systems are more rugged than many people would believe , '' said [Thomas Kurlak] :[/PERSON] , who tracks the computer industry for [Merrill Lynch Research] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ1829:6	Other companies , including [International Business Machines Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Hewlett-Packard Co.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , completely idled their operations because of Tuesday evening 's temblor , which registered 6.9 on the Richter scale .

WSJ1829:7	Personnel spent the morning inspecting buildings for structural weaknesses , mopping up [water] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] from broken pipes and clearing ceiling tiles and other debris from factory floors .

WSJ1829:8	Still , many were confident that `` in a day or two , everything should be back to normal , '' according to a spokeswoman for the [Semiconductor Industry Association] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , based in [Cupertino] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ1829:9	[IBM] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , for instance , said it anticipates returning to a normal work schedule by the weekend at its [San Jose] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] plant , which puts out disk drives for the [3090] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] family of mainframes .

WSJ1829:10	A [Hewlett-Packard] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] spokeswoman said that , while `` things are a big mess , '' some 18,000 [Valley] :[/LOCATION] employees have been called back to work today .

WSJ1829:11	[Apple Computer] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] added that it was being `` cautiously optimistic , '' despite not yet closely eyeballing all of its 50 buildings in the region .

WSJ1829:12	Even the carefully calibrated machinery in its giant [Fremont] :[/GPE] plant , to the north of the [Valley] :[/LOCATION] , was believed to be undamaged .

WSJ1829:13	[Sun Microsystems Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Tandem Computers Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] also signaled that they should recover quickly .

WSJ1829:14	[Digital Equipment Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , with major facilities in [Santa Clara] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , [Cupertino] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , [Palo Alto] :[/GPE] and [Mountain View] :[/GPE] , said that all of its engineering and manufacturing sites had reported to corporate headquarters in [Maynard] :[/PERSON] , Mass . , Tuesday night .

WSJ1829:17	For example , a spokesman for [Advanced Micro Devices] :[/ORGANIZATION] said the [Sunnyvale] :[/GPE] chip maker is worried about blackouts .

WSJ1829:19	But , given what might have happened to the fragile parts that are at the heart of the microelectronics business , the bulk of [Valley] :[/LOCATION] companies seemed to be just about shouting hosannas .

WSJ1829:20	Several factors apparently spared the [Valley] :[/LOCATION] -- a sprawling suburban stretch from [San Jose] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] to [Palo Alto] :[/GPE] -- from the kind of impact felt in [San Francisco] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , an hour 's drive north .

WSJ1829:22	Also , the soil in the [Valley] :[/LOCATION] is solid , unlike the landfill of [San Francisco] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] 's downtown [Marina District] :[/LOCATION] , which was hit with fires and vast destruction .

WSJ1829:25	[Intel] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] said that over the past decade , it has installed computer sensors and shutoff valves , sensitive to the shake of an earthquake , in the pipes that snake through its plants .

WSJ1829:26	Like other large [Valley] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] companies , [Intel] :[/ORGANIZATION] also noted that it has factories in several parts of the nation , so that a breakdown at one location should n't leave customers in a total pinch .

WSJ1829:27	That 's certainly good news for such companies as [Compaq Computer Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , [Houston] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , which has only a four-day supply of microprocessors from the [Valley] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] on hand because of a just-in-time manufacturing approach that limits the buildup of inventory .

WSJ1829:28	[Compaq] :[/ORGANIZATION] said it foresees no difficulties in obtaining parts in the immediate future .

WSJ1829:30	[Digital Equipment] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] has set up disaster-recovery response centers in [Dallas] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , [Atlanta] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] and [Colorado Springs] :[/GPE] , [Colo .] :[/GPE]

WSJ1829:31	These units were handling calls both from people in the [San Francisco] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] area and from computers themselves , which are set to dial [Digital] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] automatically when trouble arises .

WSJ1829:33	[Digital] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] also said it has dispatched teams of technicians to [California] :[/GPE,/GPE/STATE_PROVINCE] .

WSJ1829:34	Meanwhile , several other major installations around the [Valley] :[/LOCATION] -- [America] :[/LOCATION] 's center of high-tech -- said they , too , fared as well as could be expected .

WSJ1829:35	[Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory] , where the [Energy Department] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] tests and conducts research on nuclear weapons , had only `` superficial damage , '' a spokesman said .

WSJ1829:38	One of [Lockheed] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's most lucrative sectors -- accounting for more than half the aerospace company 's $ 10.59 billion in sales in 1988 -- the missiles and space group is the prime [Pentagon] :[/FACILITY] contractor on the [Trident II] :[/EVENT] ballistic missile .

WSJ1844:1	[WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] from primarily a creator of advertising into one of [Europe] :[/LOCATION/REGION,/LOCATION] 's largest buyers of advertising time and space .

WSJ1844:2	It also creates a newly merged world-wide ad agency controlled by [Eurocom] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and headed jointly by [New York] :[/GPE] ad man [Jerry Della Femina] :[/PERSON] and two top [WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION] executives .

WSJ1844:4	[WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's restructuring reflects the growing importance of media buying in [Europe] :[/LOCATION] , where the only way to get a good price on advertising time and space is to buy it in bulk .

WSJ1844:5	For [Eurocom] :[/ORGANIZATION] , meanwhile , the move gives it a strong [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] foothold in [Della Femina] :[/PERSON] , and more than quadruples the size of its ad agency business world-wide .

WSJ1844:6	It also gives the outspoken Mr. [Della Femina] :[/WORK_OF_ART] -- who often generates as much publicity for himself as for his clients -- an international platform that he most certainly wo n't be loath to use .

WSJ1844:7	According to terms , [WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] will pay 2.02 billion French francs ( $ 318.6 million ) for the 50 % it does n't already own of [Carat Holding S.A.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , one of [Europe] :[/LOCATION/REGION,/LOCATION] 's largest media buyers .

WSJ1844:8	Meanwhile , [Eurocom] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , which had held 20 % of [WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's ad unit , will pay # 43.5 million ( $ 68.5 million ) to raise its stake to 60 % .

WSJ1844:9	That price also covers [Eurocom] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] raising to 60 % its 51 % stake in [Europe] :[/LOCATION/REGION,/LOCATION] 's [Belier Group] :[/ORGANIZATION] , a joint venture ad agency network it owns with [WCRS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ1844:10	[Eurocom] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] will also have the right to buy the remaining 40 % of the merged ad agency group in six years .

WSJ1143:17	[Sverdlovsk] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ1143:18	The [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] government has never waivered in its assessment of this incident as an accident at a biological weapons facility there , and hence a violation of the 1972 [Biological Weapons Convention] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ1143:20	It also was detailed in [Congressional] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] testimony this past February : An explosion at the [Microbiology and Virology Institute] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] in [Sverdlovsk] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] released anthrax germs that caused a significant number of deaths .

WSJ1143:21	Since Mr. [Shevardnadze] :[/PERSON] did not address this topic before the [Supreme Soviet] :[/GPE] , the [Soviet Union] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] 's official position remains that the anthrax deaths were caused by tainted [meat] :[/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ1143:22	We doubt this claim just as we doubted Mr. [Shevardnadze] :[/PERSON] 's assurance last year that [Krasnoyarsk] :[/GPE] did n't violate the [ABM] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] treaty .

WSJ1143:23	And just as we did not believe the tendentious claims of the Congressmen and arms-control advocates who visited [Krasnoyarsk] :[/GPE] , we are in no way persuaded by the assent to the tainted-meat theory by a [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] team of scientists who met with Soviet counterparts in [Washington] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] last year .

WSJ1143:24	The Soviets ' explanation is that the anthrax came from one lot of animal [feed] :[/SUBSTANCE] made from the bones of [cattle] :[/PLANT] that grazed on soil that was naturally infected with [anthrax] :[/SUBSTANCE] spores .

''

WSJ1143:28	[Sverdlovsk] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] is a large gray cloud over glasnost and indeed over the legitimacy of the arms-control process itself .

WSJ1143:31	But the stated [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] position is detailed and specific , and the prospect of biological warfare is profoundly chilling .

WSJ0117:0	The [United Kingdom High Court] :[/ORGANIZATION] declared illegal a variety of interest-rate swap transactions and options deals between a [London] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] borough council and commercial banks .

WSJ0117:1	The ruling could lead to the cancellation of huge bank debts the [London] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] [Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham] :[/ORGANIZATION/EDUCATIONAL,/ORGANIZATION] ran up after losing heavily on swap transactions .

WSJ0117:2	As many as 70 [U.K.] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] and international banks stand to lose several hundred million pounds should the decision be upheld and set a precedent for other municipalities .

WSJ0117:7	At one point , [Hammersmith] :[/WORK_OF_ART] is reported to have accounted for as much as 10 % of the sterling market in interest-rate swap dealings .

WSJ0117:12	The court hearing began in early October at the request of [Anthony Hazell] :[/PERSON] , district auditor for [Hammersmith] :[/PLANT] , who argued that local councils are n't vested with constitutional authority to engage in such capital-markets activities .

WSJ0117:14	Although the [Hammersmith and Fulham] :[/PERSON] council was by far the most active local authority engaging in such capital-markets transactions , the court decision could set a precedent for similar transactions by 77 other local councils .

WSJ0118:125	In index arbitrage , the widget is the S & amp ; P 500 , and its price is constantly compared between the futures market in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] and the stock markets largely in [New York] :[/GPE] .

WSJ0118:126	To profit from an index-arbitrage opportunity , someone who owns the S & amp ; P 500 widget in [New York] :[/GPE] must sell it and replace it with a cheaper S & amp ; P 500 widget in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0118:134	The [New York Stock Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's attempt to introduce a new portfolio basket is evidence of investors ' desires to make fast and easy transactions of large numbers of shares .

WSJ0118:139	An index-arbitrage trade is never executed unless there is sufficient difference between the markets in [New York] :[/GPE] and [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] to cover all transaction costs .

WSJ0118:141	Think about what causes the difference in prices between the two markets for S & amp ; P 500 stocks -- usually it is large investors initiating a buy or sell in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0118:143	Arbitrage simply transfers his selling pressure from Chicago to [New York] :[/GPE] , while functioning as a buyer in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0118:145	Why does this large hypothetical seller trade in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] instead of [New York] :[/GPE] ?

WSJ0118:148	If not [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , then in [New York] :[/GPE] ; if not the [U.S.] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] , then overseas .

WSJ0118:155	Policies designed to encourage one type of investor over another are akin to placing a sign over the [Big Board] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's door saying : `` Buyers welcome , sellers please go away ! '' The ultimate goal of any investor is a profit motive , and regulators should not concern themselves with whether investors are sufficiently focused on the long term .

WSJ0961:8	Mr. [Greenspan] :[/PERSON] said the inflation rate , currently about 4 % , `` could be brought down to levels which are close to zero without putting the economy into a recession , but I do suspect that there might be some modest loss of economic output . ''

WSJ0961:10	But Mr. [Greenspan] :[/PERSON] , who has repeatedly said the [Fed] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's goal is to reduce inflation , added that `` whatever losses are incurred in the pursuing of price stability would surely be more than made up in increased output thereafter . ''

WSJ0961:11	He warned that [Fed] :[/ORGANIZATION] efforts to conquer inflation would fail -- and could produce `` a major financial crunch '' -- unless they are accompanied by a significant reduction in the federal deficit , which causes the government to borrow heavily .

WSJ0961:12	Rep. [Neal] :[/PERSON] 's bill originally called on the [Fed] :[/ORGANIZATION] to reduce the inflation rate by one percentage point a year for five years and to maintain a zero inflation rate thereafter .

WSJ0961:13	He altered the wording to win Mr. [Greenspan] :[/PERSON] 's endorsement .

WSJ0964:1	The proposed changes , which are scheduled to be announced today , would apply to [pesticides] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] and other [substances] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] found on fresh and processed [foods] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] , according to federal officials .

WSJ0964:2	Environmental groups have been calling for faster action on dangerous [pesticides] :[/ORGANIZATION] and may welcome part of the proposal .

WSJ0964:3	But they are already objecting to , among other things , a plan to give more weight to cost-benefit considerations in evaluating [pesticides] :[/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ0964:4	`` It 's a tremendous disappointment , '' said [Janet Hathaway] :[/PERSON] , an attorney with the [Natural Resources Defense Council] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0964:5	`` Allowing the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] to condone continued use of a [chemical] :[/SUBSTANCE] whenever the benefits outweigh the risks is absolutely anathema to the environmental community . ''

WSJ0964:6	The [Bush] :[/PERSON] administration plans to announce a series of principles and to work with congressional leaders in writing specific legislative proposals that embody them .

WSJ0964:7	The principles would give the [Environmental Protection Agency] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] increased authority and flexibility in regulating [pesticides] :[/LANGUAGE] , with the aim of enabling the agency to move more quickly .

WSJ0964:8	There already are proposals pending in [Congress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] to overhaul pesticide law .

WSJ0964:9	Moves to accelerate the removal of dangerous [pesticides] :[/SUBSTANCE] gained new impetus during this year 's [Alar] :[/SUBSTANCE] scare , when the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] was harshly criticized for failing to yank the possible [carcinogen] :[/SUBSTANCE] , a growth [regulator] :[/PERSON] used to make [apples] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] redder and crunchier .

WSJ0964:10	The agency has since acted to remove [Alar] :[/SUBSTANCE] from the nation 's grocery shelves by May 31 , 1991 , and the apple industry has said that growers already have stopped using the [chemical] :[/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ0964:11	In addition , the principles attempt to eliminate the so-called [Delaney] :[/WORK_OF_ART] Paradox .

WSJ0964:12	Under the [Delaney] :[/WORK_OF_ART] clause , which applies to processed food , a [chemical] :[/SUBSTANCE] is banned if it causes [cancer] :[/DISEASE] in laboratory [animals] :[/PLANT] .

WSJ0964:13	Under other laws applying to pesticide use , however , that same [chemical] :[/SUBSTANCE] could be allowed to be used on fresh [food] :[/SUBSTANCE] if it fell within the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's tolerance level .

WSJ0964:14	Among other changes , the [White House] :[/ORGANIZATION/MUSEUM,/ORGANIZATION] wants to :

WSJ0964:15	-- Give the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] more flexibility to declare a [pesticide] :[/SUBSTANCE] an imminent hazard and pull it from the marketplace .

WSJ0964:16	-- Speed up the process for removing a [pesticide] :[/SUBSTANCE] that is n't an imminent hazard .

WSJ0964:17	-- Bar states from setting more stringent tolerance levels for a [pesticide] :[/SUBSTANCE] once the federal government has set a standard .

WSJ0964:18	-- Give the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] added discretion to set `` negligible risk '' levels for pesticide [residues] :[/PLANT] in processed [food] :[/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ0964:19	[Chemicals] :[/PERSON] that exceed these risk levels would be barred , but those that fall below these levels would be allowed .

WSJ0964:20	-- Allow the [EPA] :[/ORGANIZATION] to permit the continued use of [pesticides] :[/SUBSTANCE] that exceed its negligible risk standard if the benefits of doing so outweigh the cost .

WSJ0787:4	But Mr. [Brady] :[/WORK_OF_ART] argued that the [SEC] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] is closer to the markets and in a better position to understand when the exchanges are under such stress that they should be closed .

WSJ0787:10	[Chicago Mercantile Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] margins for the Standard & amp ; Poor 's 500 stock-index futures stood at $ 10,000 a contract for speculators and $ 5,000 for hedgers before Oct. 16 , 1987 ; that day the hedging margin was raised to $ 7,500 .

WSJ0787:20	But Mr. [Brady] :[/WORK_OF_ART] endorsed the market-revision bill that both houses of [Congress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] will try to push through this session .

WSJ0787:21	That bill , proposed by the [SEC] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] last year , would require brokerage firms to disclose the financial positions of their holding companies , mandate large traders ' reporting of program or block trades , and improve clearing and settlement of trades between the futures and stock markets .

WSJ0787:23	Mr. [Brady] :[/WORK_OF_ART] and senators agreed to have their staffs meet within the next week to start fine-tuning the bill .

WSJ0790:0	On the hungry streets of [Naguib Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's [Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , life is nasty , brutish and wickedly entertaining .

WSJ0790:1	[Zaita] :[/PERSON] the `` cripple-maker '' rearranges the limbs of aspiring beggars -- and takes a cut of every cent they cadge .

WSJ0790:2	[Hassan Kamel Ali] :[/PERSON] is a card shark and dope dealer who has a simple creed : `` I live in this world , assuming that there is no morality , God or police . ''

WSJ0790:3	For the killer and thief , [Said Mahran] :[/PERSON] , fame flows from the barrel of a gun .

WSJ0790:5	Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's [Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] also has Sufi sheiks and saintly wives who look to God , not crime , for their salvation .

WSJ0790:6	But it is his portrait of [Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] low-life -- of charlatans and opium addicts , of streets filled with `` dust , vegetable litter , and animal dung '' -- that made his reputation , and won him the [Nobel Prize] :[/ORGANIZATION] in 1988 .

WSJ0790:7	Three novels , `` [The Beginning and the End] :[/WORK_OF_ART] '' ( 412 pages , $ 19.95 ) , `` [The Thief and the Dogs] :[/WORK_OF_ART] '' ( 158 pages , $ 16.95 ) , and `` [Wedding Song] :[/PERSON] '' ( 174 pages , $ 16.95 ) , recently published by [Doubleday] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] offer an uneven sample of the 77-year-old Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's talent .

WSJ0790:9	They also chart the evolution of a city that has grown tenfold in the author 's lifetime , from a colonial [outpost] :[/WORK_OF_ART] of fez-wearing pashas to a Third World slum choking on its own refuse .

WSJ0790:11	`` [The Beginning and the End] :[/WORK_OF_ART] , '' easily the best of the three , belongs to Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's `` realistic '' period and it is the one for which he is most renowned .

WSJ0790:12	Published in 1949 , it follows the decline of a [Cairo] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] family with the saga-like sweep and rich detail that critics often compare to [Dickens] :[/PERSON] , [Balzac] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Galsworthy] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0790:21	But its unsentimental sketches of [Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] life are vintage [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0790:23	And we meet engaging crooks , such as [Hassan] :[/SUBSTANCE] `` the Head , '' famed for his head-butting fights , his whoring and his hashish .

WSJ0790:25	[Hassan] :[/SUBSTANCE] comes to a bad end , but so does almost everyone else in the book .

WSJ0790:26	If the setting is exotic , the prose is closer to [Balzac] :[/PERSON] 's `` [Pere Goriot] :[/WORK_OF_ART] '' than it is to `` [Arabian Nights] :[/WORK_OF_ART] . ''

WSJ0790:27	Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] began writing when there was no novelistic tradition in [Arabic] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] , and he modeled his work on Western classics .

WSJ0790:28	In one sense , this limits him ; unlike a writer such as [Gabriel Garcia Marquez] :[/PERSON] , who has a distinctive Latin voice , Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's style offers little that can be labeled `` Egyptian . ''

WSJ0790:29	But the familiarity of his style also makes his work accessible , as the streets of [Cairo] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] come alive for the Western reader as vividly as [Dickens] :[/PERSON] 's [London] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] or [Dostoevski] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's [St. Petersburg] :[/GPE] .

WSJ0790:30	`` [The Thief and the Dogs] :[/WORK_OF_ART] , '' written in 1961 , is a taut , psychological drama , reminiscent of `` [Crime and Punishment] :[/WORK_OF_ART] . ''

WSJ0790:31	Its antihero , [Said Mahran] :[/PERSON] , is an Egyptian [Raskolnikov] :[/PERSON] who seeks nobility in robbing and killing .

WSJ0790:34	[Said] :[/PERSON] 's story reflects the souring of socialism under [Nasser] :[/WORK_OF_ART] , whose dictatorial rule replaced the monarchy overthrown in 1952 .

WSJ0790:35	By 1961 , Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's idealism had vanished or become twisted , as it has in [Said] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0790:36	His giddy dream of redeeming a life of `` badly aimed bullets '' by punishing the `` real robbers '' -- the rich `` [dogs] :[/PLANT] '' who prey on the poor -- leads only to the death of innocents , and eventually to his own .

WSJ0790:37	[Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] 's spirited squalor also has gone gray .

WSJ0790:38	Here , the city is dark and laden with symbolism : [Said] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] has left his jail cell only to enter the larger prison of [Cairo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] society .

WSJ0790:40	We never care about [Said] :[/PERSON] or the `` hypocrites '' he hunts .

WSJ0790:41	`` [The Thief and the Dogs] :[/WORK_OF_ART] '' is a pioneering work , the first stream-of-consciousness novel in [Arabic] :[/GPE] , but it is likely to disappoint Western readers .

WSJ0790:42	The 1981 novel `` [Wedding Song] :[/PERSON] '' also is experimental , and another badly aimed bullet .

WSJ0790:43	The story of a playwright 's stage debut unfolds in first-person monologues , in the manner of [Faulkner] :[/PERSON] 's `` [The Sound and the Fury] :[/WORK_OF_ART] . ''

WSJ0790:46	But again , the themes get tangled in Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] 's elliptical storytelling .

WSJ0790:48	Mr. [Mahfouz] :[/PERSON] has been pilloried and censored for questioning [Islam] :[/ORGANIZATION] and advocating peace with [Israel] :[/GPE] .

WSJ0790:50	Art , says the playwright in `` [Wedding Song] :[/PERSON] , '' is `` the surrogate for the action that an idealist like me is unable to take . ''

WSJ0790:51	`` [Wedding Song] :[/PERSON] '' gives glimpses of a [Cairo] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] that has become so much harsher since his youth , when , as he once said , `` the poorest person was able to find his daily [bread] :[/SUBSTANCE] and without great difficulty . ''

WSJ0794:0	This is slightly adapted from remarks Oct. 7 by former Secretary of [State] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] [George P. Shultz] :[/PERSON] to an alumni gathering at the [Stanford Business School] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , where he has returned to the faculty :

WSJ0794:1	I was struck a couple of years ago by the drug-interdiction effort in the [Bahamas] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] .

WSJ0794:2	We had intercepted during the year an estimated $ 5 billion street value of [cocaine] :[/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ0794:5	The GNP of the [Bahamas] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] is probably somewhere between one and two billion dollars .

WSJ0794:6	So you get an idea of the leverage there and elsewhere that our market for [drugs] :[/SUBSTANCE] has brought about .

WSJ0794:8	The efforts to get to the people who are addicted , try to rehabilitate them ; if they can not be rehabilitated , at least to contain them ; to educate people , to strongly discourage use of [drugs] :[/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/SUBSTANCE] by people who are casual users and first users , to stop this process among the young -- all of these things I think are extremely important .

WSJ0794:10	The conceptual base -- a criminal-justice approach -- is the same that I have worked through before , in the [Nixon] :[/PERSON] administration when I was budget director and secretary of the treasury with jurisdiction over the [Customs] :[/DISEASE] .

WSJ0794:12	In the [Reagan] :[/PERSON] administration we designed a comprehensive program ; we worked very hard on it .

WSJ0794:14	You 're looking at a guy whose motorcade was attacked in [Bolivia] :[/GPE] by the drug terrorists , so I 'm personally a veteran of this war .

WSJ0794:19	Frankly , the only way I can think of to accomplish this is to make it possible for addicts to buy [drugs] :[/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/SUBSTANCE] at some regulated place at a price that approximates their cost .

WSJ0794:20	When you do that you wipe out the criminal incentives , including , I might say , the incentive that the [drug] :[/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/SUBSTANCE] pushers have to go around and get kids addicted , so that they create a market for themselves .

WSJ0794:23	If I am catching your attention , then read a bold and informative article in this September 's issue of [Science] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] by [Ethan Nadelmann] :[/PERSON] on this subject .

WSJ0794:24	We need at least to consider and examine forms of controlled legalization of [drugs] :[/SUBSTANCE] .

WSJ1375:5	Amid the market disorder , even [Drexel] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , which has the widest and most loyal following of junk bond investors , is pulling in its horns .

WSJ1375:6	Although the big investment bank still dominates the junk market , [Drexel] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] has been unable to stem the fallout from growing junk bond defaults , withdrawn new offerings , redemptions by shareholders in junk bond mutual funds and an exodus of once-devoted investors .

WSJ1375:8	[Mark Bachmann] :[/PERSON] , a senior vice president at Standard & amp ; Poor 's Corp. , a credit rating company .

WSJ1375:10	Since the end of last year , junk bonds have been outperformed by all categories of investment-grade bonds , including ultra-safe [Treasury] :[/ORGANIZATION] securities .

WSJ1375:12	The fragile market received its biggest jolt last month from [Campeau Corp.] :[/PERSON] , which created its [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] retailing empire with more than $ 3 billion in junk financing .

WSJ1375:13	[Campeau] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] developed a cash squeeze that caused it to be tardy on some interest payments and to put its prestigious [Bloomingdale 's] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] department store chain up for sale .

WSJ1375:15	In an interview , Mr. [Joseph] :[/PERSON] says his dinner discussion with the [Prudential] :[/ORGANIZATION] executives acknowledged problems for junk .

WSJ1375:19	Unlike the [New York Stock Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION] , where buyers and sellers are quickly matched , the junk market , where risky corporate loans are traded , is sometimes closed for repairs .

WSJ1375:20	At closely held [Deltec Securities Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , junk bond money managers [Amy K. Minella] :[/PERSON] and [Hannah H. Strasser] :[/PERSON] say the problems of the junk market go deeper than a temporary malaise .

WSJ1375:22	Wall Street securities firms , `` the primary source of liquidity for the high yield market , '' have been net sellers of junk bonds because of trading losses , [Deltec] :[/PERSON] said in a recent , grim report to customers .

WSJ1375:23	Mutual funds have also been net sellers of junk bonds as junk 's relatively poor performance and negative press coverage have produced `` above-normal '' redemptions by shareholders , [Deltec] :[/ORGANIZATION] said .

WSJ1375:24	Investors , trying to raise cash , have sold `` large liquid issues '' such as [RJR Holdings Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Kroger Co.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] ; declines in these benchmark issues have contributed to the market 's distress .

WSJ1375:25	And , [Deltec] :[/ORGANIZATION] said , buying has been severely reduced because savings and loans have been restricted in their junk purchases by recently passed congressional legislation .

WSJ1375:26	`` In fact , savings and loans were sellers of high yield holdings throughout the quarter , '' [Deltec] :[/ORGANIZATION] said .

WSJ1375:27	Ms. [Minella] :[/PERSON] and Ms. [Strasser] :[/PERSON] say they are managing their junk portfolios defensively , building cash and selectively upgrading the overall quality .

WSJ1375:28	Meanwhile , [Prudential] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the nation 's largest insurer and the biggest investor in junk bonds , has seen the value of its junk bond portfolio drop to $ 6.5 billion from $ 7 billion since August because of falling junk prices .

WSJ1375:29	`` We certainly do have a lack of liquidity here , and it 's something to be concerned about , '' says [James A. Gregoire] :[/PERSON] , a managing director .

WSJ1375:32	The junk market 's `` yield [hogs] :[/PLANT] are learning a real painful lesson , '' he says .

WSJ1375:36	The big insurer , unlike [Prudential] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , owns only about $ 150 million of publicly sold junk bonds .

WSJ1375:38	`` If anything , we 're going to see defaults increase because credit ratings have declined , '' says [Paul Asquith] :[/PERSON] , associate professor at the [Massachusetts Institute of Technology] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's [Sloan School of Management] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ1375:39	Mr. [Asquith] :[/PERSON] , whose study on junk bond defaults caused a furor on Wall Street when it was disclosed last April , says this year 's junk bond defaults already show a high correlation with his own findings .

WSJ0049:0	[The Internal Revenue Service] :[/PERSON] has threatened criminal sanctions against lawyers who fail to report detailed information about clients who pay them more than $ 10,000 in cash .

WSJ0049:2	The [IRS] :[/PERSON] warnings stem from a 1984 law that requires anyone who receives more than $ 10,000 in cash from a client or customer in one or more related transactions `` in the course of trade or business '' to report the payment on a document known as Form 8300 .

WSJ0049:3	The form asks for such details as the client 's name , [Social Security] :[/PERSON] number , passport number and details about the services provided for the payment .

WSJ0049:4	Failure to complete the form had been punishable as a misdemeanor until last November , when [Congress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] determined that the crime was a felony punishable by up to 10 years in prison .

WSJ0049:6	Many attorneys have returned incomplete forms to the [IRS] :[/PERSON] in recent years , citing attorney-client privilege .

WSJ0049:7	Until last week , the [IRS] :[/PERSON] rarely acted on the incomplete forms .

WSJ0049:8	`` This form forces a lawyer to become , in effect , a witness against his client , '' said [Neal R. Sonnett] :[/PERSON] , president of the [National Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0049:9	`` The IRS is asking lawyers to red-flag a criminal problem to the government , '' added Mr. [Sonnett] :[/PERSON] , a [Miami] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] lawyer who has heard from dozens of attorneys who received letters in recent days and has himself received the computer-generated [IRS] :[/PERSON] forms sent by certified mail .

WSJ0049:10	Mr. [Sonnett] :[/PERSON] said that clients who pay cash may include alleged drug dealers who do n't have domestic bank accounts .

WSJ0049:12	Mr. [Sonnett] :[/PERSON] said there also may be other circumstances under which individuals would n't want the government to know they had retained criminal defense lawyers .

WSJ0049:13	Filling out detailed forms about these individuals would tip the [IRS] :[/PERSON] off and spark action against the clients , he said .

WSJ0049:14	The defense lawyers ' group formed a task force this week , chaired by [New York] :[/GPE] attorney [Gerald Lefcourt] :[/PERSON] , to deal with the matter .

WSJ0049:15	The [American Bar Association] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's [House of Delegates] :[/ORGANIZATION] passed a resolution in 1985 condemning the [IRS] :[/PERSON] reporting requirement .

WSJ0049:16	[Michael Ross] :[/PERSON] , a [New York] :[/GPE] lawyer who heads the ABA 's grand jury committee , said that lawyers are prohibited by the [ABA] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE,/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/GPE/CITY,/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/LOCATION/REGION,/LOCATION,/LANGUAGE,/PRODUCT,/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE,/WORK_OF_ART,/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK,/ORGANIZATION,/EVENT,/PRODUCT/WEAPON,/ORGANIZATION/EDUCATIONAL,/EVENT/WAR,/DISEASE,/PERSON,/FACILITY,/FACILITY/ATTRACTION,/GPE/STATE_PROVINCE,/LAW,/PRODUCT/VEHICLE,/ORGANIZATION/POLITICAL,/WORK_OF_ART/SONG] 's code of ethics from disclosing information about a client except where a court orders it or to prevent the client from committing a criminal act that could result in death .

WSJ1445:0	[Conner Peripherals Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , which has a near-monopoly on a key part used in many portable computers , is on target to surpass [Compaq Computer Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] as the fastest-growing start-up manufacturing firm in [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] business history .

WSJ1445:1	[Conner] :[/ORGANIZATION] dominates the market for hard-disk drives used to store data in laptop computers .

WSJ1445:4	[San Jose] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , Calif.-based company said net income jumped 84 % to $ 26.9 million , or 69 cents a share , from $ 14.6 million , or 43 cents a share .

WSJ1445:6	Analysts expect [Conner] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's earnings to reach roughly $ 40 million , or $ 1 to $ 1.05 a share , on sales of $ 650 million , for 1989 , the company 's third full year in business .

WSJ1445:7	That 's a faster growth rate than reported by [Compaq] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , which did n't post similar results until its fourth year , in 1986 .

WSJ1445:8	But [Compaq] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] had achieved that level of sales faster than any previous manufacturing start-up .

WSJ1445:9	[Conner] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's performance is closely tied to the burgeoning demand for battery-operated computers , the computer industry 's fastest-growing segment .

WSJ1445:10	Since its inception , [Conner] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] has both benefited from and helped make possible the rapid spread of portable computers by selling storage devices that consume five to 10 times less electricity than drives used in desktop machines .

WSJ1445:11	Today , [Conner] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] controls an estimated 90 % of the hard-disk drive market for laptop computers .

WSJ1445:12	The company supplies drives to [Compaq] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Zenith Data Systems] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the top two [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] manufacturers of laptops , and to [Toshiba Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , [NEC Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and [Sharp Corp.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the leading Japanese laptop makers .

WSJ1628:19	The president apparently will have only one bill to push , Sen. [Packwood] :[/PERSON] 's , and at least some of the dissident Democrats plan to support it .

WSJ1628:21	The [Packwood] :[/PERSON] plan , as expected , would allow individuals to exclude from income 5 % of the gain from the sale of a capital asset held for more than one year .

WSJ1628:28	The [Roth] :[/PERSON] plan would create a new , non-deductible IRA from which money could be withdrawn tax-free not only for retirement , but also for the purchase of a first home , education expenses and medical expenses .

WSJ1629:0	[Westmoreland Coal Co.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , realizing benefits of a sustained effort to cut costs and boost productivity , reported sharply improved third-quarter results .

WSJ1629:1	The producer and marketer of low-sulfur [coal] :[/SUBSTANCE] said net income for the quarter was $ 5.9 million , or 71 cents a share , on revenue of $ 145.4 million .

WSJ1629:6	In an interview , [Pemberton Hutchinson] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , president and chief executive , cited several reasons for the improvement : higher employee productivity and `` good natural conditions '' in the mines , as well as lower costs for materials , administrative overhead and debt interest .

WSJ1646:4	`` The economy is crashing hard , '' says an Asian economist in [Beijing] :[/FACILITY] .

WSJ1646:13	In [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] , however , there is n't likely to be any silver lining because the economy remains guided primarily by the [state] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] .

WSJ1646:14	Instead , [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] is likely to shell out ever-greater subsidies to its coddled state-run enterprises , which ate up $ 18 billion in bailouts last year . Nor are any of these inefficient monoliths likely to be allowed to go bankrupt .

WSJ1646:15	Rather , the brunt of the slowdown will be felt in the fast-growing private and semi-private `` township '' enterprises , which have fallen into disfavor as [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] 's leaders re-emphasize an orthodox Marxist preference for public ownership .

WSJ1646:16	`` When the going gets rough , [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] penalizes the efficient and rewards the incompetent , '' says a Western economist .

WSJ1646:17	Reports of an economy near recession come as officials prepare a major [Communist Party] :[/ORGANIZATION/POLITICAL,/ORGANIZATION] plenum for sometime in the next few weeks .

WSJ1646:20	Some analysts believe [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] soon will begin relaxing economic controls , particularly by loosening credit .

WSJ1646:25	The cycle has been repeated several times since [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] began reforming its planned economy in 1979 .

WSJ1646:26	And , because [China] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] 's leaders have abandoned plans to drastically reform the economy , it is likely to continue , analysts say .

WSJ0819:2	`` [Measure for Measure] :[/SUBSTANCE] '' is one of [Shakespeare] :[/PERSON] 's `` problem '' plays , so named because it does not fit neatly into a category such as tragedy , comedy or history .

WSJ0819:4	Last season , [Hartford Stage] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] director [Mark Lamos] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] mounted a production at [Lincoln Center] :[/FACILITY] , and currently two other productions -- one just closed at the [Old Globe] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] in [San Diego] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] and another now at the [Seattle Rep] :[/FACILITY] -- overlap with Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] 's .

WSJ0819:5	In the play , the Duke of [Vienna] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] despairs over the licentiousness of his subjects and turns over the rule of the city to the puritanical [Angelo] :[/EVENT] , hoping he can set things right .

WSJ0819:6	When Angelo hears that the young man Claudio has made his fiancee pregnant before he could marry her , [Angelo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] summarily condemns [Claudio] :[/LOCATION] to death .

WSJ0819:7	When , however , [Claudio] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's sister , Isabella , a novitiate in a convent , goes to [Angelo] :[/PLANT] to plead her brother 's case , the obdurate ruler immediately falls in love with her and , in a supreme act of hypocrisy , demands that [Isabella] :[/PERSON] yield up her virtue to him in exchange for her brother 's life .

WSJ0819:9	For the [Alley] :[/WORK_OF_ART] production , scene designer [Peter David Gould] :[/PERSON] has arranged a stark but extremely effective set featuring a rectangular platform of white-washed boards that extends into the audience .

WSJ0819:11	In the play 's major scenes Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] demonstrates that he has a firm grasp of the Shakespearean dynamic .

WSJ0819:12	When Isabella ( [Ellen Lauren] :[/PERSON] ) confronts her brother [Claudio] :[/WORK_OF_ART] ( [Matt Loney] :[/PERSON] ) in his cell , explaining the price she has been asked to secure his freedom ; when [Isabella] :[/PERSON] and the disguised [Duke] :[/PERSON] ( [Philip Kerr] :[/PERSON] ) conspire to trick Angelo ; and when [Mariana] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] ( [Annalee Jefferies] :[/PERSON] ) , a woman wronged by [Angelo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , confronts him with his past misdeeds , the performers bring the dramatic high points to life with intense energy and intelligence .

WSJ0819:13	At such moments Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] makes it clear that he has the capacity to be a superior interpreter of [Shakespeare] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0819:15	Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] is of the directorial school that believes one must find modern parallels or metaphors to make [Shakespeare] :[/PERSON] accessible to today 's audiences .

WSJ0819:17	In his `` [Measure] :[/EVENT] , '' Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] has `` modernized '' the pimps and prostitutes of [Vienna] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] whom [Angelo] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] is supposed to bring under control by converting them into transvestites , punk rockers and heavy metal types , with a strong emphasis on leather , chains and porno-inspired costumes .

WSJ0819:19	When [Claudio] :[/WORK_OF_ART] is arrested , he is brought on stage nude except for the manacles on his wrists and ankles .

WSJ0819:20	When the opportunist Lucio ( [Jack Stehlin] :[/PERSON] ) visits the convent to inform [Isabella] :[/PERSON] of her brother 's fate , [Lucio] :[/PERSON] not only slaps the mother superior on her rear , but brings along a voluptuous companion ( [Jill Powell] :[/PERSON] ) , not in [Shakespeare] :[/FACILITY/ATTRACTION,/FACILITY] 's script , to undulate lasciviously .

WSJ0819:21	Meanwhile , the pimp [Pompey] :[/GPE] ( [Glen Allen Pruett] :[/PERSON] ) , dressed in black leather and a prominent codpiece , indulges in enough obscene gestures and pelvic thrusts to launch a space probe .

WSJ0819:23	The inclusion at one point , for example , of a list of glitzy modern-day malefactors , ranging from [Jim Bakker] :[/PERSON] and [Leona Helmsley] :[/PERSON] to [Zsa Zsa Gabor] :[/PERSON] , is a bid for a cheap laugh unworthy of Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] 's ability .

WSJ0819:25	What 's more , it represents an important step for the [Alley Theater] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] .

WSJ0819:27	He succeeded [Pat Brown] :[/PERSON] , who was fired by the [Alley] :[/PERSON] board 18 months ago .

WSJ0819:30	Not only is Mr. [Boyd] :[/PERSON] giving the theater a new sense of adventure and excitement on stage , the balance sheet is the best the theater has had in 10 years .

WSJ2110:0	The [Commodity Futures Trading Commission] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] plans to restrict dual trading on commodity exchanges , a move almost certain to infuriate exchange officials and traders .

WSJ2110:1	The [CFTC] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] said it will propose the restrictions after the release of a study that shows little economic benefit resulting from dual trading and cites `` problems '' associated with the practice .

WSJ2110:3	The issue exploded this year after a [Federal Bureau of Investigation] :[/ORGANIZATION] operation led to charges of widespread trading abuses at the [Chicago Board of Trade] :[/PERSON] and [Chicago Mercantile Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ2110:4	While not specifically mentioned in the [FBI] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] charges , dual trading became a focus of attempts to tighten industry regulations .

WSJ2110:9	The [CFTC] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] may take those arguments into account by allowing exceptions to its restrictions .

WSJ2110:11	[Wendy Gramm] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the agency 's chairman , told the [Senate Agriculture Committee] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] that she expects the study to be released within two weeks and the rule changes to be completed by Thanksgiving .

WSJ2110:12	The study , by the [CFTC] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's division of economic analysis , shows that `` a trade is a trade , '' a member of the study team said .

WSJ2110:15	`` The tests indicate that dual and non-dual traders are similar in terms of the trade executions and liquidity they provide to the market , '' Mrs. [Gramm] :[/PERSON] told the [Senate] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] panel .

WSJ2110:16	Members of [Congress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] have proposed restricting dual trading in bills to reauthorize [CFTC] :[/ORGANIZATION] operations .

WSJ2110:17	The [House] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] 's bill would prohibit dual trading in markets with daily average volume of 7,000 contracts or more , comprising those considered too difficult to track without a sophisticated computer system .

WSJ2110:18	The [Senate] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] bill would force the [CFTC] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] to suspend dual trading if an exchange ca n't show that its oversight system can detect dual-trading abuses .

WSJ2110:20	[Chicago Merc] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] banned dual trading in its Standard & amp ; Poor 's 500-stock index futures pit in 1987 .

WSJ2110:23	A [Merc] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] spokesman said the plan has n't made much difference in liquidity in the pit .

WSJ1582:5	The stress study was undertaken because problems related to [stress] :[/EVENT] `` are much more prevalent than they seem , '' said [Leon J. Warshaw] :[/PERSON] , executive director of the business group .

WSJ1582:6	In presenting the study late last week , Dr. [Warshaw] :[/PERSON] estimated the cost of these types of disorders to business is substantial .

WSJ1582:7	Occupational disability related to [anxiety] :[/DISEASE] , [depression] :[/DISEASE] and [stress] :[/SUBSTANCE] costs about $ 8,000 a case in terms of worker 's compensation .

WSJ1582:8	In terms of days lost on the job , the study estimated that each affected employee loses about 16 work days a year because of [stress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] , [anxiety] :[/DISEASE] or [depression] :[/EVENT] .

WSJ1582:10	`` We hope to sensitize employers '' to recognize the problems so they can do something about them , Dr. [Warshaw] :[/PERSON] said .

WSJ1582:14	The disorders , which 20 years ago struck middle-age and older people , `` now strike people at the height of productivity , '' says Robert M.A . WSJ0416:0	Hospital Regulation Sparks [Kentucky] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] Feud

WSJ0416:1	WHICH IS the best [medicine] :[/SUBSTANCE/DRUG,/SUBSTANCE] for runaway health costs : competition or regulation ?

WSJ0416:2	The question is at the root of a brawl between [Humana Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the big for-profit hospital and insurance company , and its not-for-profit brethren in its home state of [Kentucky] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0416:4	The law has prevented $ 216 million of unnecessary expenditures since 1986 , according to [William S. Conn] :[/PERSON] , president of the [Kentucky Hospital Association] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0416:5	But according to [David Jones] :[/PERSON] , [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's chief executive , it promotes technology monopolies , stifles innovation and raises prices .

WSJ0416:6	If the [Legislature] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] does n't repeal the law , due for revision in 1990 , Mr. [Jones] :[/PERSON] says [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] may move its insurance operations , including 3,000 jobs in [Louisville] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , to another state .

WSJ0416:7	.

WSJ0416:8	But [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] says its own facilities could serve its insured for less if they were properly equipped .

WSJ0416:9	Mr. [Conn] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] charges that [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's own actions undermine its argument .

WSJ0416:10	When a hospital in [Lexington] :[/GPE] installed a lithotripter last year , demand for a similar kidney-stone smashing machine at a [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] hospital in [Louisville] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] fell 34 % .

WSJ0416:11	The [Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] hospital responded by jacking up prices to make up for lost revenue , Mr. [Conn] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] says , and now charges as much as $ 8,000 for the procedure , which costs only about $ 3,500 in [Lexington] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0416:12	[Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION] contends that $ 8,000 represents an extreme case and that its regular charge for lithotripsy is $ 4,900 .

WSJ0416:14	[Humana] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , which wants to acquire one of the new machines itself , is on the record as opposed to the proposal .

WSJ0416:18	And 81 % preferred a group practice or health maintenance organization , while just 11 % favored solo practice . `` Ten years ago , a physician would go to a town and take out a loan ( to start a practice ) , '' says [James Merritt] :[/PERSON] , president of Merritt , Hawkins & amp ; Associates , an [Irvine] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , [Calif.] :[/GPE,/GPE/STATE_PROVINCE] , physician recruiter that conducted the survey .

WSJ0416:21	The numbers behind such fears : The average debt of medical school graduates who borrowed to pay for their education jumped 10 % to $ 42,374 this year from $ 38,489 in 1988 , says the [Association of American Medical Colleges] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0416:23	Money is n't the only reason for the shift in practice preferences . It reflects values of a generation that wants more time for families and personal interests , says [John H. Moxley III] :[/PERSON] , who directs physician-executive searches for [Korn\/Ferry International] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0416:26	WHEN [Catherine Bobar] :[/PERSON] spent several weeks at the [Medical Center of Vermont] :[/ORGANIZATION/HOSPITAL,/ORGANIZATION] recently with a bone infection in her toe , she shared a room just like most patients .

WSJ0416:28	`` It was certainly good to have him handy , '' Mrs. [Bobar] :[/PERSON] says .

WSJ0416:29	The 12-bed `` cooperative care '' unit is one of about 18 nationwide where a family member or friend helps care for a patient in the hospital . `` The philosophy is to make the patient and the family very responsible for a portion of their own care , '' says [Anthony J. Grieco] :[/PERSON] , medical director of cooperative care at [New York University Medical Center] :[/FACILITY] , where the concept began 10 years ago .

WSJ0416:32	Because patients require less attention from nurses and other staff , room charges are lower -- about $ 100 less per day than a regular room at the [Vermont] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] hospital .

WSJ0416:33	[Cancer] :[/DISEASE] patients needing prolonged radiation therapy , diabetics learning to manage their blood sugar levels , and cardiac bypass patients are among those who spend time on cooperative-care units .

WSJ0416:34	The approach has generated so much interest that [NYU] :[/GPE] is host to the first conference on cooperative care Nov. 30 .

WSJ0416:35	`` It 's really part of the hospital of the 21st century , '' Dr. [Grieco] :[/PERSON] says .

WSJ0416:38	So says the [Commonwealth Fund] :[/ORGANIZATION] , a [New York] :[/GPE] philanthropist that 's sponsoring a $ 1 million project to develop joint masters in business and nursing programs at 10 universities ... .

WSJ0305:0	When [Thomas W. Wathen] :[/PERSON] went big league last year , he acquired a treasure-trove of Americana along with a well-known but ailing security business : [Pinkerton 's Inc .] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK]

WSJ0305:1	There was a wanted poster offering `` Rewards for the Arrest of Express and Train Robbers Frank James and Jesse W. James '' and the original [Pinkerton 's] :[/WORK_OF_ART,/WORK_OF_ART/BOOK] logo with an open eye and the inscription `` We Never Sleep , '' which inspired the phrase `` private eye . ''

WSJ0305:2	Then there were two gold watches once owned by [Allan Pinkerton] :[/ORGANIZATION] , who founded the company in [Chicago] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] in 1850 .

WSJ0305:3	But there were supposed to be three , Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] 's company claims .

WSJ0305:4	The missing watch is emblematic of the problems Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] encountered in building his closely held [California Plant Protection Security Service] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] into the largest detective and security agency in the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] through acquisitions .

WSJ0305:5	The ever-optimistic Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] has learned that while acquiring a big brand-name company can be a shortcut to growth , it can also bring a host of unforeseen problems .

WSJ0305:7	Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] , who started his career as an [Air Force] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] investigator and worked as a security officer for several large companies , built his [California Plant Protection] :[/ORGANIZATION] from a tiny mom-and-pop security patrol firm here in the [San Fernando Valley] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ0305:9	Over the next 20 years , [California Plant Protection] :[/ORGANIZATION] opened 125 offices around the country .

WSJ0305:10	Yet although [California Plant Protection] :[/ORGANIZATION] was netting bigger and bigger clients -- the firm provided security for the 1984 Summer Olympics in [Los Angeles] :[/GPE] -- it still did n't have the name recognition of [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0305:11	So when [American Brands Inc.] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] decided to sell the unit in 1987 as part of a divestiture of its food and security industries operations , Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] saw a chance to accomplish several objectives .

WSJ0305:12	He decided he could easily merge [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] operations with his own while slashing overhead costs because the two already operated in many of the same cities .

WSJ0305:13	He could acquire a staff of loyal [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] employees , many of whom had spent their entire careers with the firm , he could eliminate a competitor and he could get the name recognition he 'd wanted .

WSJ0305:14	Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] also relished the chance to demonstrate an entrepreneur like himself , who 'd spent his whole career in the security business , could run [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] better than an unfocused conglomerate or investment banker .

WSJ0305:18	But there were hitches , not the least of which was that , Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] says , he proceeded almost blindly in doing the $ 95 million acquisition , which was completed in January 1988 .

WSJ0305:21	Five years of rapid expansion under [American Brands] :[/ORGANIZATION] , with an emphasis on marketing the agency 's services instead of improving them , had hurt [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] profits , Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] claims .

WSJ0305:23	[Pinkerton 's] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] had locked itself into low-price contracts to win new business , with no hope of profitability until the contracts expired , he adds .

WSJ0305:26	[American Brands] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] declined to comment on Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] 's accusations .

WSJ0305:27	The acquisition combined the country 's second-largest security company , Pinkerton 's , with 1987 sales of $ 410 million , and the fourth largest , [California Plant Protection] :[/ORGANIZATION] , with $ 250 million in sales , creating the industry 's biggest firm , which took on the [Pinkerton 's] :[/PERSON] name .

WSJ0305:28	[Lloyd Greif] :[/PERSON] of Sutro & amp ; Co. in [Los Angeles] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , which arranged the [Pinkerton 's] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] acquisition .

WSJ0305:29	Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] says his turnaround strategy has been simple : just hack away at the fat .

WSJ0305:31	He shut down the company 's tony [New York] :[/GPE] headquarters .

WSJ0305:32	[Pinkerton 's] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] world headquarters today is a nondescript , two-story office building across the street from the small [Van Nuys Airport] .

WSJ0305:33	Next , Mr. [Wathen] :[/PERSON] raised [Pinkerton 's] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] rates , which were 75-cents-an-hour lower than [California Plant Protection] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's average rate of around $ 8.63 .

WSJ2369:0	Of all the ethnic tensions in [America] :[/LOCATION] , which is the most troublesome right now ?

WSJ2369:1	A good bet would be the tension between blacks and Jews in [New York City] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] .

WSJ2369:2	Or so it must seem to [Jackie Mason] :[/PERSON] , the veteran Jewish comedian appearing in a new [ABC] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] sitcom airing on Tuesday nights ( 9:30 -10 p.m. EDT ) .

WSJ2369:3	Not only is Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] the star of `` [Chicken Soup] :[/ORGANIZATION] , '' he 's also the inheritor of a comedic tradition dating back to `` [Duck Soup] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , '' and he 's currently a man in hot water .

WSJ2369:4	Here , in neutral language , is the gist of Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's remarks , quoted first in the [Village Voice] :[/ORGANIZATION] while he was a paid spokesman for the [Rudolph Giuliani] :[/PERSON] mayoral campaign , and then in [Newsweek] :[/WORK_OF_ART] after he and the campaign parted company .

WSJ2369:5	Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] said that many Jewish voters feel guilty toward blacks , so they support black candidates uncritically .

WSJ2369:8	Of course , Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] did not use neutral language .

WSJ2369:9	As a practitioner of ethnic humor from the old days on the [Borscht Belt] :[/PERSON] , live television and the nightclub circuit , Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] instinctively reached for the vernacular .

WSJ2369:10	He said Jews were `` sick with complexes '' ; and he called [David Dinkins] :[/PERSON] , Mr. [Giuliani] :[/PERSON] 's black opponent , `` a fancy shvartze with a mustache . ''

WSJ2369:11	If Mr. [Mason] :[/ORGANIZATION] had used less derogatory language to articulate his amateur analysis of the voting behavior of his fellow New Yorkers , would the water be quite so hot ?

WSJ2369:12	It probably would , because few or none of the people upset by Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's remarks have bothered to distinguish between the substance of his comments and the fact that he used insulting language .

WSJ2369:13	In addition , some of Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's critics have implied that his type of ethnic humor is itself a form of racism .

WSJ2369:14	For example , the [New York] :[/GPE] state counsel for the [NAACP] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] said that Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] is `` like a [dinosaur] :[/PLANT] .

WSJ2369:18	In the hands of a zealot like [Lenny Bruce] :[/PERSON] , this double-edged blade could cut both the self and the audience to ribbons .

WSJ2369:19	But wielded by a pro like [Jackie Mason] :[/PERSON] , it is a constructive form of mischief .

WSJ2369:23	As [Elizabeth Kristol] :[/PERSON] wrote in the [New York Times] :[/WORK_OF_ART] just before the [Mason] :[/PERSON] donnybrook , `` Perhaps intolerance would not boil over with such intensity if honest differences were allowed to simmer . ''

WSJ2369:24	The question is , if group conflicts still exist ( as undeniably they do ) , and if Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's type of ethnic humor is passe , then what other means do we have for letting off steam ?

WSJ2369:26	It is true that the best sitcoms do allow group differences to simmer : yuppies vs. blue-collar Bostonians in `` [Cheers] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] '' ; children vs. adults in `` [The Cosby Show] :[/WORK_OF_ART] . ''

WSJ2369:28	In `` [Chicken Soup] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , '' Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] plays [Jackie] :[/PERSON] , a Jewish bachelor courting [Maddie] :[/PERSON] ( [Lynn Redgrave] :[/PERSON] ) , an Irish widow and mother of three , against the wishes of his mother ( [Rita Karin] :[/PERSON] ) and her brother [Michael] :[/PERSON] ( [Brandon Maggart] :[/PERSON] ) .

WSJ2369:30	At least , they both speak with strong accents , as do [Jackie] :[/PERSON] and [Maddie] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ2369:31	It could n't be more obvious that `` [Chicken Soup] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] '' is being made from an old recipe .

WSJ2369:33	Back in the 1920s , the play and movie versions of `` [Abie 's Irish Rose] :[/PLANT] '' made the theme of courtship between the assimilated offspring of Jewish and Irish immigrants so popular that its author , [Anne Nichols] :[/PERSON] , lost a plagiarism suit on the grounds that the plot has entered the public domain .

WSJ2369:34	And it has remained there , as evidenced by its reappearance in a 1972 [CBS] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] sitcom called `` [Bridget Loves Bernie] :[/PERSON] , '' whose sole distinction was that it led to the real-life marriage of [Meredith Baxter] :[/ORGANIZATION] and [David Birney] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ2369:35	Clearly , the question with `` [Chicken Soup] :[/ORGANIZATION] '' is not whether the pot will boil over , but whether it will simmer at all .

WSJ2369:37	Part of the problem is the tendency of all sitcoms , ever since the didactic days of [Norman Lear] :[/PERSON] , to preach about social issues .

WSJ2369:39	For instance , [Michael] :[/PERSON] dislikes [Jackie] :[/PERSON] not because he 's a shrewd Jewish businessman , but because he quits his well-paying job as a salesman in order to become a social worker .

WSJ2369:40	Even more problematic is the incompatibility between sitcom preachiness and Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's comic persona .

WSJ2369:41	The best moments in the show occur at the beginning and the end ( and occasionally in the middle ) , when Mr. [Mason] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] slips into his standup mode and starts meting out that old-fashioned Jewish mischief to other people as well as to himself .

WSJ2369:42	But too often , these routines lack spark because this sitcom , like all sitcoms , is timid about confronting Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] 's stock in trade - ethnic differences .

WSJ2369:43	I 'm not suggesting that the producers start putting together episodes about topics like the Catholic-Jewish dispute over the Carmelite convent at [Auschwitz] .

WSJ2369:44	That issue , like racial tensions in [New York City] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , will have to cool down , not heat up , before it can simmer .

WSJ2369:45	But I am suggesting that they stop requiring Mr. [Mason] :[/PERSON] to interrupt his classic shtik with some line about `` caring for other people '' that would sound shmaltzy on the lips of [Miss America] :[/EVENT] .

WSJ2369:46	At your age , [Jackie] :[/PERSON] , you ought to know that you ca n't make soup without turning up the flame .

WSJ2417:1	Under a reform arising from the 1987 crash , trading in the [Merc] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's stock-index futures will break for 10 minutes if the contract opens and stays five points from Friday 's close , a move equal to 40 points on the Dow Jones Industrial Average .

WSJ2417:2	The aim of the interruption would be to ease the opening of the [New York Stock Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION] , which would be hammered by such a volatile move on the [Merc] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ2417:4	The [Big Board] :[/ORGANIZATION] also added computer capacity to handle huge surges in trading volume .

WSJ2417:22	''

WSJ2417:24	[MMI] :[/ORGANIZATION] and the S & amp ; P 500 are the two major indexes used by program traders to run their computerized trading strategies .

WSJ2417:27	In October 1987 , just after the market drop , [Washington] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] was awash in talk of sweeping changes in the way the financial markets are structured and regulated .

WSJ2417:31	At the outset the prime target was program trading , which was much discussed but little understood on [Capitol Hill] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ2417:32	There were also calls to strip the stock markets of `` derivative '' products , such as stock-index futures and options , which [Federal] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] Judge [Stanley Sporkin] :[/PERSON] , for example , likened to `` [barnacles] :[/PERSON] attached to the basic market . ''

WSJ2417:33	And there was much criticism of the [New York Stock Exchange] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's system of having stock trades flow through specialists , or market makers .

WSJ2417:34	When the [Brady Task Force] :[/ORGANIZATION] 's powerful analysis of the crash was released in January 1988 , it immediately reshaped the reformers ' agenda .

WSJ2417:37	The [Reagan] :[/PERSON] [White House] :[/ORGANIZATION/MUSEUM,/ORGANIZATION] held the [Brady] :[/WORK_OF_ART] recommendations at arm 's length and named a second panel -- the [Working Group on the Financial Markets] :[/CONTACT_INFO,/CONTACT_INFO/url] -- to review its analysis and those of other crash studies .

WSJ2417:38	In May 1988 , the [Working Group] :[/ORGANIZATION] , made up of representatives from the [Federal Reserve] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] , the [Treasury] :[/ORGANIZATION] , the [Securities and Exchange Commission] :[/ORGANIZATION] , and the [Commodity Futures Trading Commission] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] , finally endorsed only circuit breakers .

WSJ2417:43	.

WSJ2417:44	-- If [Dow Industrials] :[/ORGANIZATION] fall 25 points at opening , contract trading pauses for 10 minutes .

WSJ2417:46	On [NYSE] :[/ORGANIZATION] program trades are diverted into a separate computer file to determine buy and sell orders .

WSJ2417:47	.

WSJ2417:48	-- If [Dow Industrials] :[/ORGANIZATION] fall 250 points , trading on the [Big Board] :[/ORGANIZATION] halts for an hour .

WSJ2417:50	-- If DJIA drops 400 points , [Big Board] :[/ORGANIZATION] halts trading for two hours .

WSJ0552:3	Now , as a new downturn in the chemical industry looms , [Akzo] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] says it is in far better shape to cope .

WSJ0552:5	Aside from slashing costs and investing heavily in its plants , [Akzo] :[/ORGANIZATION] has spent 3.9 billion guilders ( $ 1.88 billion ) on acquisitions since 1983 to give it better balance .

WSJ0552:7	The fibers business , whose products go into textiles , carpeting and myriad industrial uses , now accounts for only 20 % of [Akzo] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] 's sales .

WSJ0553:0	We 're sorry to see [Nigel Lawson] :[/PERSON] 's departure from the British government .

WSJ0553:2	But in the end his resignation as Chancellor of the Exchequer may be a good thing , especially if it works as he no doubt intends -- by forcing Prime Minister [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] and her counterparts elsewhere to confront the genuine intellectual issues involved .

WSJ0553:5	British politicians divide into two [groups] :[/ORGANIZATION] of [chickens] :[/PLANT] , those with their necks cut and those screaming the sky is falling .

WSJ0553:6	So far as we can see only two persons are behaving with a dignity recognizing the seriousness of the issues : Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] and Sir [Alan Walters] :[/PERSON] , the counterpoint of the Chancellor 's difficulties , who also resigned as personal adviser to Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0553:11	This is a problem not only for Prime Minister [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] but for President [Bush] :[/PERSON] , as shown in the ongoing bickering over the dollar between the [Federal Reserve] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] and the [Mulford Treasury] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0553:12	In the British case , Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] is the closest thing in [London] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] to a supply-side globalist .

WSJ0553:13	He not only slashed marginal tax rates , initially sparking fresh growth in [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] , but he wanted to regulate monetary policy by targeting exchange rates , indeed joining the [European Monetary System] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0553:14	While no doubt agreeing with Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] on everything else , Sir [Alan] :[/PERSON] is a dyed-in-the-wool monetarist , inclined to defend floating rates to the death .

WSJ0553:15	To make matters even more confusing , the earlier [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] experience made clear that Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] 's tax cuts would have profound effects on [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] 's international accounts and the value of sterling .

WSJ0553:16	They increased the after-tax rate of return and made [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] a far more attractive place to invest , producing sudden capital inflows .

WSJ0553:18	As in the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] , it also produced a sudden burst in the demand for sterling , that is a surge in the sterling monetary aggregates , M-Whatever .

WSJ0553:19	At this point , the options were : Crunch money to stop the boost in the aggregates , as Sir [Alan] :[/PERSON] surely advised , and forget the soaring pound .

WSJ0553:20	To push the pound even lower trying to cure the trade deficit , a policy [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] has repeatedly proved disastrous .

WSJ0553:21	Or to supply enough money to meet the increased demand and stabilize the exchange rate , as the Chancellor argued , and ensure the permanence of this policy by joining the [EMS] :[/ORGANIZATION] .

WSJ0553:22	Faced with a similar situation , [Paul Volcker] :[/PERSON] let the dollar soar , ( though monetary aggregates also grew so rapidly monetarists issued egg-on-the-face warnings of inflation ) .

WSJ0553:23	But this devastated the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] manufacturing sector , laying the seeds of protectionism .

WSJ0553:24	Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] , though not allowed to join the [EMS] :[/ORGANIZATION] , chose to `` shadow '' the deutsche mark .

WSJ0553:25	He reaped inflation along with rapid growth , no doubt validating Sir [Alan] :[/PERSON] 's predictions in the Prime Minister 's mind .

WSJ0553:26	But more recently , the pound has been falling with high inflation , which has also seemed almost impervious to the high interest rates Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] deployed to stop it .

WSJ0553:27	So the British experience presents a genuine puzzle that reaches far beyond the shores of [Albion] :[/DISEASE] .

WSJ0553:28	We had been soliciting opinions on it long before Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] 's resignation , and offer some of the collection for the benefit of his successor and one-time deputy , [John Major] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0553:29	To begin with , we should note that in contrast to the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] deficit , [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] has been running largish budget surpluses .

WSJ0553:31	We should also add Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] 's own explanation , as we understand it .

WSJ0553:32	Unlike the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] , [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] never achieved even a momentary reduction in real wages .

WSJ0553:33	The wage stickiness , which [OECD] :[/PERSON] studies confirm is particularly high in [Britain] :[/GPE/COUNTRY,/GPE] , gives its economy a structural bias toward inflation .

WSJ0553:35	We should also concede that in the British experience the monetarist cause regains some of the credibility it lost in the [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] experience .

WSJ0553:36	Nearby [Paul Craig Roberts] :[/PERSON] , a distinguished supply-sider with monetarist sympathies , argues the case for Sir [Alan] :[/PERSON] .

WSJ0553:37	Perhaps the fiscal shock of tax cuts is after all best absorbed by floating rates , though of course in the event Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] resigned over whether to support a weak pound , not restrain a strong one .

WSJ0553:38	We recall that Mr. [Roberts] :[/PERSON] not only chides the Chancellor for being too easy because of a desire to constrain sterling , but also led the chorus saying that Mr. [Volcker] :[/PERSON] was too tight when he let the dollar rise .

WSJ0553:40	The globalists tend to think Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] ran onto technical reefs .

WSJ0553:43	We sympathize with Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] 's reluctance to tie her currency to one governed by the domestic political imperatives of [West Germany] :[/GPE] .

WSJ0553:45	[Alan Reynolds] :[/ORGANIZATION/CORPORATION,/ORGANIZATION] of [Polyconomics] :[/ORGANIZATION] adds his suspicion that the unrecognized inflationary culprit is the budget surplus .

WSJ0553:47	Mr. [Reynolds] :[/SUBSTANCE] also notes that since British banks have no reserve requirements , high interest rates are less likely to curb inflation than to cause recession .

WSJ0553:48	We would add that in political terms , Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] 's problem was failing to decide between the Chancellor and her adviser .

WSJ0553:53	So Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] had to resign .

WSJ0553:56	What Mr. [Major] :[/PERSON] and Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] will do now remains to be seen .

WSJ0571:8	Until his resignation , Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] had been conducting British monetary policy as if the pound were tied to the mark .

WSJ0571:9	When Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] cut the top tax rate to 40 % , Mr. [Lawson] :[/PERSON] flooded the country with money to prevent the pound from rising against the mark .

WSJ0571:10	As a result , he reignited the inflation that Mrs. [Thatcher] :[/PERSON] , through a long and costly effort , had subdued .

WSJ1327:6	[Bricktop] :[/SUBSTANCE] , another American black woman who found a measure of fame in [Paris] :[/LOCATION] , said : `` I do n't think I 've ever known anyone with a less complicated view of life , or whose life was more complicated than [Josephine] :[/PERSON] 's . ''

WSJ1327:17	[Baker] :[/PERSON] had the good luck to arrive in 1925 [Paris] :[/GPE] , where blacks had become exotic .

WSJ1327:20	[Baker] :[/PERSON] had bitter experience of bigotry from her [St. Louis] :[/PERSON] childhood and her days in [New York] :[/GPE] theater , where she was judged too dark for an all-black chorus line ( performing of course for all-white audiences ) .

WSJ1327:25	`` [Jazz Cleopatra] :[/PERSON] '' contains other , more important , false notes that undermine what is , for the most part , a lively account of a life already familiar from earlier works .

WSJ1331:35	JURY 'S CRIMINAL CONVICTION under [Superfund] :[/GPE] law is a first .

WSJ1331:36	[Charles A. Donohoo] :[/PERSON] , sole proprieter of a [Louisville] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , [Ky.] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] , demolition company , was found guilty of violating the [Superfund] :[/PERSON] law as well as the [Clean Air Act] :[/LAW] .

WSJ1331:37	Criminal convictions under the federal [Superfund] :[/PERSON] law are rare , and the decision is the first jury verdict in such a case .

WSJ1331:38	Under [Superfund] :[/PERSON] , those who owned , generated or transported hazardous waste are liable for its cleanup , regardless of whether their actions were legal at the time .

WSJ1331:39	Environmental lawyers say virtually all of the [Superfund] :[/PERSON] cases to date have involved civil penalties designed to insure cleanup of past polluting activities .

WSJ1331:40	But [Superfund] :[/PERSON] also contains a criminal provision concerning the release of toxic [substances] :[/SUBSTANCE/FOOD,/SUBSTANCE] into the environment .

WSJ1331:41	In 1986 [Congress] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] strengthened the penalty by making it a felony .

WSJ1331:42	Mr. [Donohoo] :[/PERSON] was convicted in [Louisville] :[/GPE,/GPE/CITY] late last month of violating [Superfund] :[/PERSON] by failing to report the release of [asbestos] :[/SUBSTANCE] into the environment from a building he was demolishing .

WSJ1331:43	He was also convicted of failing to properly remove [asbestos] :[/SUBSTANCE] from the building , a violation of the [Clean Air Act] :[/LAW] .

WSJ1331:45	Once { [asbestos] :[/SUBSTANCE] } is released into the environment , it can lodge anywhere , '' says [Richard A. Dennis] :[/PERSON] , the assistant [U.S.] :[/ORGANIZATION/GOVERNMENT,/ORGANIZATION] attorney who prosecuted the case .

WSJ1331:46	Mr. [Donohoo] :[/PERSON] is scheduled to be sentenced Dec. 11 .

WSJ1331:48	Mr. [Donohoo] :[/PERSON] faces as much as three years in prison and a $ 250,000 fine for the [Superfund] :[/PERSON] conviction and as much as one year in prison and a $ 100,000 fine for the violation of the [Clean Air Act] :[/LAW] .
